name: Scraptics
desc: A tactical turn-based roguelike on a hex grid with a unique inventory puzzle mechanic. Pitched in an internal game jam, greenlit for full production, and led as programmer, designer, and team lead for 3 years at Halfbrick Studios. Shipped to closed beta on iOS and Android.
bullets: Architected the full systems stack: turn management, hex-grid logic, roguelike progression, and inventory puzzle systems
Wrote complex recursive algorithms powering the core puzzle mechanic
Designed and programmed enemy AI behavior systems
Developed custom editor tools to support content creation and team workflows
Built full UI/UX across all game screens and menus
Cross-platform iOS & Android builds with profiling and performance optimization
Leaderboard networking and metadata architecture using Unity Cloud Services
Cross-platform save systems
Led a team of 4 developers across the full production lifecycle

name: Sumo Fight
desc: Multiplayer beat-em-up party game built in one week. Lead programmer on a team of 5.
bullets: Photon networking for player customization sync and core gameplay

name: Survivors Aren't Dead
desc: Survivor-like action game built in one week. Pitched the concept, led the project, and served as lead programmer on a team of 4.
bullets: Created the pitch and core design document
Lead programmer, enemy behavior programmer, and sound designer

name: Rucksack Dungeon
desc: The prototype that became Scraptics. Built in one week at an internal Halfbrick game jam, greenlit for full production, and reworked into the full game over the following 3 years. Team lead and AI behavior programmer.
bullets: Designed and implemented AI enemy behaviour systems
Team lead across the full jam week

name: Unannounced Mobile Project
desc: A 2D side-scrolling endless runner with a novel physics-driven swinging mechanic. Created the prototype that was greenlit, then led the project until it was paused due to shifting company priorities.
bullets: Created the original prototype establishing the core loop and swinging mechanic
Led physics prototyping and mechanical iteration
Project lead and lead programmer for a team of 4

name: To The Moon!
desc: Competitive 3D space dogfighter. Capstone project at Full Sail University. Project lead on a team of 6.
bullets: AI fighter ships using steering behaviors and compute shaders for improved framerate at scale
Full Photon networking stack: GameManager, MatchManager, weapons, projectiles, loading transitions, procedural map generation
All multiplayer UI: ready-up system, name changing, lobby/player listing, scoreboard, score tracking, and hit registration
Player controller with single/multiplayer versions via polymorphism and inheritance

name: Memoria Damnum
desc: 2D platformer built in 48 hours for Global Game Jam 2020. Programming lead on a team of 9.
bullets: Object pooling system for collectibles with persistent collection state
Contributed to level design, audio systems, GameManager architecture, and VFX

name: Retrospectre
desc: Retrowave-inspired 2.5D metroidvania platformer. Project lead on a team of 4.
bullets: AI systems for 8+ distinct enemy types with varied behaviors and attack patterns
Player controller, weapon systems, and projectile mechanics
Level design and all interactable systems: destructible areas, climbable walls, moving platforms, environmental puzzles
